snippet: Advertising rates for commercial during the Grammy Awards, which will be shown on CBS on Sunday, Feb. 11, have risen commensurately with the award show's ratings increase in recent years.
abstract: Advertising rates for commercial during the Grammy Awards, which will be shown on CBS on Sunday, Feb. 11, have risen commensurately with the award show's ratings increase in recent years.
lead_paragraph: What is the dollar value of the Grammy Awards' recent ratings turnaround? According to one report, that increased viewership translates into an additional $750,000 a minute. Like other big televised award shows, the Grammys have had increased ratings in recent years, a trend often ascribed to the appeal of large-scale live events in the DVR age. In 2010 after years of sliding ratings, the Grammys had 25.87 million viewers, a 35 percent jump from the year before, according to Nielsen. Last year hit a 10-year high with 26.67 million viewers. Advertising rates on the awards, which will be shown again on CBS on Sunday, Feb. 11, have risen commensurately. Read more »

headline.main: As Ratings Rise, So Does Grammy's Ad Haul
